than expected l oss Broadcom reported a pro forma net loss for the quarter of milli on or cents per share compared to a year ago profit of million or cents per share According to First Call analysts had expected the comp any to report a loss of cents per share The company said revenue for t he quarter rose percent to million from million in the same quarter last year We are now seeing an improved level of stability and visibility in the markets that we serve said Dr Henry T Nicholas III B roadcoms President and CEO As a result we have increased confidence that the steps we have taken and continue to take to scale and redistribute our investments are appropriate Broadcom closed Wednesdays regular trading down at on a volume of million shares In after hours tr ading Broadcom has or per share down from a profit of million or per share in th e same period last year Wall Street analysts had expected the company to l ose per share according to a survey conducted by First
